Table of Contents
Field Collection Group Managers and Territory Managers are responsible for ensuring compliance with the guidance and procedures described in this IRM.
a. Director, Field Collection Report
This monthly report encompasses all Field Collection including International and provides measures on the per
formance of Field Collection. b. International Territory Report
This monthly report provides measures on the performance of the International Territory. c. ENTITY End of Month Report
This report provides monthly data on inventory counts, case sub codes, case type, group monthly data and time allocation.

a. Collection Policy will conduct ad hoc International Program reviews as necessary to verify compliance with IRM requirements and to address Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration/U.S. Government Ac
countability Office ﬁndings. b. Case reviews are conducted by Group Managers to ensure compliance with this IRM.
5.21 International and Insular Issues
This table lists commonly used acronyms and their deﬁnitions:
Acronym Deﬁnition ICS Integrated Collection System LB&I Large Business & International SB/SE Small Business/Self-Employed TDA Taxpayer Delinquent Account TDI Taxpayer Delinquency Investigation

) Make an international ﬁeld call only on an as-needed basis when there are several taxpayer cases in one location which can be addressed on the trip.
(1) Make an international ﬁeld call only on an as-needed basis when there are several taxpayer cases in one location which can be addressed on the same
(04-02-2018) Making International Field Calls
Exception: You may request approval for a trip to make an international ﬁeld call for just one case if sufficient justiﬁcation exists.
See IRM 5.1.10.3, Initial Contact, for more information on initial contact for taxpayers located in a foreign country.
Consult your Group Manager when you determine an international ﬁeld call is
) Provide justiﬁcation to your Group Manager if you need to make an tional trip on your cases. (

) Do not make an international ﬁeld visit simply to hand deliver a document is stipulated as requiring hand delivery. Instead: a. Document clearly in the Integrated Collection System (ICS) history ﬁeld call to hand deliver a letter, notice, or document cannot be b. Send the item registered mail to the foreign country. (
) Secure an official passport. Access the LB&I (Large Business & International Travel Office website at: http://lmsb.irs.gov/rs/ﬁn/ Internationa
ravel/ITO_Passports.asp for instructions on applying for an passport. Note: It takes about two to three months to process a request for an official passport. (
) Consider the need to raise the spending limit on your government credit or the need to charge the air ticket to the SB/SE Centrally Billed Account. (
) Discuss these needs with your manager, if applicable. (
) Arrange scheduled meetings with taxpayers at the U.S. Embassy or U.S. sulate’s Office in the country of travel whenever possible. (

) Unannounced ﬁeld calls should not be made while physically in a foreign country as this conduct is inconsistent with the approved purpose of your country clearance and may violate host country laws. Pre-arrange meeting space through the IRS office, if there is one. Send appointment letters to the taxpayer(s) you will meet with on the ﬁeld a. Secure conﬁrmation replies before planning your itinerary. b. Send an information letter if there are other taxpayers in that area whom you were unable to conﬁrm. Include the following in the information letter:

Consider the need to raise the spending limit on your government credit card or the need to charge the air ticket to the SB/SE Centrally Billed Account.
Include the following in the information letter:

) ICS does not track time charged to a case based on the type of contact (e.g., ﬁeld contact); therefore, to track ﬁeld time, it is necessary that each employee who contacts taxpayers or attends to case-related business while in the ﬁeld properly reports the amount of time spent in the ﬁeld. The amount of time charged to time code
Field Time is for informational purposes only and not affect the overall balance of time charged for the day. (
) For international cases only, if case-related travel time is not charged directly to a speciﬁc case then time code
Miscellaneous Direct should be used to account for this case related travel. During the ICS/ENTITY and Collection
5.21 International and Insular

reported to time code 809 which rolls the hours into direct case time codes 101 and 201, based on the number of Taxpayer Delinquent Accounts (TDAs) and Taxpayer Delinquency Investigations (TDIs) respectively in the group. Therefore, time reporting for travel to and from the foreign country should be under time code 621 Field Time and time code 809 Miscellaneous Direct in lieu of reporting time to speciﬁc cases. Any travel time outside of the normal tour of duty should also be charged to time code 710 Credit/Comp Hours Earned. If travel is made on one case, then all time will be charged to the and not to time code 809.
